CatDescriptText: Mrs. Dorothy Holland, housewife, 7445 Roce Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "I think the teachers are not cooperating enough with the parents. The teachers should go into the homes and get the parents to understand that their help is very necessary in order to help the children get a desire to learn.  There should be no lowering of educational standards."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of smiling Dorothy Holland wearing dark flecked coat, standing on sidewalk near drug store
